thread.section_title: NWAonline stories: High School Sports - Northwest Arkansas
thread.title: CLASS 2A

title: CLASS 2A
text:
Posted: October 17, 2015 at 1:51 a.m. 
SUPER SIX 
ENGLAND 58, CUTTER MORNING STAR 0 
HOT SPRINGS — England remained undefeated (7-0, 4-0 5-2A) with a road victory over winless Cutter Morning Star (0-7, 0-4). 
Quarterback Brayden Brazeal went 7-of-8 for 75 yards and threw 2 touchdowns. Brazeal also scored a touchdown on an 85-yard interception return. 
Malike Coleman had 2 carries for 48 yards and 1 touchdown, while Spencer Apel carried 5 times for 40 yards and a touchdown for the Lions. 
England’s Heath Carter caught 2 passes for 30 yards for a touchdown and Kamarius Crompton had 2 receptions for 20 yards and a touchdown. 
DES ARC 48, MARVELL 12 
DES ARC — Colt Covington returned a kickoff for a touchdown to help Des Arc (6-1, 4-1 6-2A) down Marvell (0-7, 0-5). O.C. Conway had a 20-yard run and Noah Kennedy ran 1 yard for two of the Eagles’ other touchdowns. 
JUNCTION CITY 20, BEARDEN 6 
JUNCTION CITY — C.J. Johnson had 23 carries for 204 yards as Junction City defeated Bearden in an 8-2A showdown at Paul Muse Field. Will Smith passed for two touchdowns and ran for another for Junction City, which finished with 280 yards rushing. 
5-2A 
CONWAY CHRISTIAN 54, QUITMAN 18 
CONWAY — Jakob Henry completed 16 of 21 passes for 373 yards and 6 touchdowns to lead Conway Christian (4-3, 3-1 5-2A) past Quitman (4-3, 2-2). 
Henry also rushed for a touchdown. Seth Smith caught 4 passes for 194 yards and 4 touchdowns. Jon Mark Wood caught 6 passes for 86 yards. 
The Eagles led 7-0 at the end of the first quarter, 28-12 at halftime and 47-18 at the end of the third quarter. 
Trey McGhee rushed 24 times for 119 yards and 3 touchdowns. He also completed 8 of 18 passes for 64 yards. 
7-2A 
LAFAYETTE COUNTY 48, 
DIERKS 40 
DIERKS — Tre’Darius Burks rushed for 299 yards and 4 touchdowns on 18 carries and Lafayette County (6-1, 4-0 7-2A) held off Dierks (3-3, 2-2). 
Burks scored on runs of 79, 63, 5 and 48 yards for the Cougars, who were outgained 496-433 by the Outlaws. 
Trendin McKinney led Dierks with 196 yards and 1 touchdown on 32 carries. Jake Green completed 11 of 27 passes for 210 yards and 3 touchdowns. 
MOUNT IDA 53, FOREMAN 0 
MOUNT IDA — Cody Robertson scored touchdowns three different ways as Mount Ida (7-0, 4-0 7-2A Conference) remained unbeaten with a victory over Foreman (1-6, 0-4). 
Robertson returned an intercepted 38 yards for a touchdown, then scored Mount Ida’s next touchdown on a 54-yard reception from T.J. Wilson, both in the first quarter. Robertson added a 35-yard rushing touchdown in the second quarter for a 43-0 lead. 
Trevor Frayer’s 9-yard touchdown run put Mount Ida ahead 50-0 in the first half. 
8-2A 
STRONG 24, WOODLAWN 8 
WOODLAWN — Strong (3-4, 3-1 8-2A) took a big step toward earning a playoff spot with a victory over Woodlawn (1-4, 0-4). 
Le’Andre Rucks ran for 106 yards, including a 51-yard touchdown run. He also caught a 9-yard touchdown pass from Javonte Foreman. 
(Advertisement)
